channel.title: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?
channel.description:
What framework you guys like to use to make your site responsive?
Most time i take bootstrap But i also have worked with foundation and just a little with skeleton
I think bootstrap is best , it got lots of addons and great documentation

item.title: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Bootstrap is easier and used by a lot of businesses. It’s also better to use with Ruby on Rails.

For those saying foundation is better, that is more of a personal preference type thing because there is minimum difference between the two that any designer could really care less about.

Read full topic
item.source: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?

item.title: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Pwnd:

SASS or LESS is so awesome. Nesting is my favorite part. I wish it didn’t take me so long to figure it out, but it also took me way too long to discover rails.

Bootstrap now has an official SASS repo, making it the obvious winner here.

Read full topic

item.source: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?

item.title: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Ruby:

I didn’t discover Foundation until around about a year or so ago thanks to SilentCJ

Glad to be of service

Foundation all the way for me. Though my opinion is biased as I have not had the time or need to use any other frameworks. Foundation is great for mobile device support, and has allowed me to create some pretty complex ‘web apps’ in very little time.

I’ve played around with creating a tailored framework for myself in numerous projects, but it’s a hell of a lot of effort, and never works as well as a tried and tested solution.

Also learn SASS, don’t think I could go without it now.

Read full topic
item.source: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?

item.source: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?

item.title: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:20, topic:538211”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=657038.msg4396680#msg4396680 date=1389339637]
You’d have to be a muppet to re-invent a framework when there are options like Foundation out there.
[/quote]
is muppet aussie slang for jackass?[/quote]

We use muppet in the UK quite often so it’s not strictly aussie. But yes, it means idiot more or less.

OP: I agree with Lothy, I didn’t discover Foundation until around about a year or so ago thanks to SilentCJ, I’ve used it for most of my projects since. Great resource.

Read full topic

item.title: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

[quote=“buzenr, post:15, topic:538211”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=657038.msg4396401#msg4396401 date=1389244667]

Just build it from scratch! Lol, it’s not that hard.

What a terrible and inexperienced thing to say…
[/quote]

I’m not inexperienced whatsoever, I build templates from scratch to match other one’s and they’re spot on without copying ANY code and using LESS code. Btw, they work perfect in all web browsers.[/quote]

Wow. Amazing. Such Dedication. So Efficient… Can You Show Us One Of Your Templates?

Read full topic

item.title: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“buzenr, post:9, topic:538211”]Just build it from scratch! Lol, it’s not that hard.[/quote]There’s HUGE advantages to using frameworks. Like, writing one set of code to go over the different display sizes. And getting all of the mundane items out of the way, like IE support, perfect cell/row css that is simple to use and more. It helps the people who want to spend more time on the backbone than on the visual design.

Read full topic

item.title: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Foundation and Pure are my preferred frameworks.
Also, Bootstrap’s documentation is rather extensive and covers just about any question you could have regarding the framework. Any questions regarding Bootstrap could probably be answered by any competent web developer.

Read full topic
item.source: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?

item.title: Bootstrap , foundation , skeleton etc. what you think is the best?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Bullos, post:5, topic:538211”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=657038.msg4395685#msg4395685 date=1389043723]
Foundation is probably the best web framework there is in my opinion, you missed Pure and a few similar to jQuery UI.
[/quote]
Foundation might be beter than bootstrap but bootstrap got a huge community, so actualy when you need help , bootstrap is beter :P[/quote]
Foundation has a massive community too, Bootstrap isn’t a bad resource but Foundation beats it in many professional developers opinions. I’d stick with Foundation regardless.

Also, what have you ever used the Bootstrap community for help with? I think the documentation answers everything you’d ever need.

Read full topic
